content.description:
Tu1 regere imperio populos, Romane, memento 
(hae tibi erunt artes), pacique imponere morem,
parcere subiectissubicio, -ere, -ieci, -iectum: to subdue et debellaredebello, -are = vinco, -ere superbos.
 1:refers to Aeneas↩
content.question: In line 3, what is the grammatical function of subiectis?

choices.label: a participle in an ablative absolute

unit.text: 5: Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 4, 6, 7, 11, and 12

skill.text: 1.B: Describe how grammar contributes to the meaning and function of Latin words and phrases in context.
